3.0 - Typography

'Didot' is used for titles and 'Gotham' for regular texts.

3.1 - Standard DOM Element

The following section presents the standard HTML elements and how they are styled by default.

3.1.1 - Text effects and Paragraphs

Default styling

3.1.2 - Headings

Default styling

Heading 1

Heading 2

Heading 3

Heading 4

Heading 5
Heading 6

Body text

 
<h1>Heading 1</h1>
<h2>Heading 2</h2>
<h3>Heading 3</h3>
<h4>Heading 4</h4>
<h5>Heading 5</h5>
<h6>Heading 6</h6>
<p>Body text</p>

3.1.3 - Lists

3.1.3.1 - Unordered List

Default styling
Markup:
  • Lorem Ipsum
  • Dolor Sit Amet
      • What will happen now?
    • Sub-item A
    • Sub-item B
  • Vivamus ut tellus a elit dignissim pulvinar. Morbi hendrerit massa felis, cursus egestas nulla porta non.
 
Markup:<ul>
  <li>Lorem Ipsum</li>
  <li>Dolor Sit Amet</li>
  <ul>What will happen now?
    <li>Sub-item A</li>
    <li>Sub-item B</li>
  </ul>
  <li>Vivamus ut tellus a elit dignissim pulvinar. Morbi hendrerit massa felis, cursus egestas nulla porta non.</li>
</ul>

3.1.3.2 - Ordered List

Default styling
Markup:
  1. Lorem Ipsum
  2. Dolor Sit Amet
      3. What will happen now?
    1. Sub-item A
    2. Sub-item B
  3. Vivamus ut tellus a elit dignissim pulvinar. Morbi hendrerit massa felis, cursus egestas nulla porta non.
 
Markup:<ol>
  <li>Lorem Ipsum</li>
  <li>Dolor Sit Amet</li>
  <ol>What will happen now?
    <li>Sub-item A</li>
    <li>Sub-item B</li>
  </ol>
  <li>Vivamus ut tellus a elit dignissim pulvinar. Morbi hendrerit massa felis, cursus egestas nulla porta non.</li>
</ol>

3.1.3.3 - Definition List

Some modifiers on top of the Bootstrap naked <dl>.

Default styling
Task
Some task
Author
John Doe
Created At
2014-07-16 16:00:00

inline definitions

.dl-inline
Task
Some task
Author
John Doe
Created At
2014-07-16 16:00:00

horizontal dl (from Bootstrap)

.dl-horizontal
Task
Some task
Author
John Doe
Created At
2014-07-16 16:00:00
 
<dl class="{$modifiers}">
  <dt>Task</dt>
  <dd>Some task</dd>
  <dt>Author</dt>
  <dd>John Doe</dd>
  <dt>Created At</dt>
  <dd>2014-07-16 16:00:00</dd>
</dl>

3.1.4 - Font Weight

For the text body the whole range of font weight from 100 to 900 can be used, except for 500.

Default styling

font weight = 100

font weight = 200

font weight = 300

font weight = 400

font weight = 600

font weight = 700

font weight = 800

font weight = 900

 
<p style="font-weight: 100">font weight = 100</p>
<p style="font-weight: 200">font weight = 200</p>
<p style="font-weight: 300">font weight = 300</p>
<p style="font-weight: 400">font weight = 400</p>
<p style="font-weight: 600">font weight = 600</p>
<p style="font-weight: 700">font weight = 700</p>
<p style="font-weight: 800">font weight = 800</p>
<p style="font-weight: 900">font weight = 900</p>
